From 1995 until present, product responsibility has been given priority for the first time.
The Triple Bottom Line came first into perspective in the 1990s.
From the 1945 to 1960, the “smell of money” led to a denial of pollution.
correct_answers: From 1985 to 1995, companies developed from eco efficiency to eco effectiveness.
The Triple Bottom Line came first into perspective in the 1990s.
From the 1945 to 1960, the “smell of money” led to a denial of pollution.

questions.question: What are advantages of consistency?
choices: Short-term profitability
Improving sustainability at an “absolute” level
Low investments required in the short term
No rebound effects
correct_answers: Improving sustainability at an “absolute” level

questions.question: What is Patagonias main activity doing today?
choices: Operating climbing halls
Selling outdoor clothing
Selling evening wear
Information events on the subject of sustainability
correct_answers: Selling outdoor clothing

questions.question: What are the drivers of short-termism?
choices: Sector
Mission
Management incentives and compensation
Legal form of the firm
Owners/investors
correct_answers: Sector
Mission
Management incentives and compensation
Legal form of the firm
Owners/investors

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the sustainability investing approach of “integration into financial analysis” are true?
choices: The approach is often combined with voting and engagement.
The objective of the approach is to make better investment decisions by considering additional data, such as ESG ratings.
The approach is relatively new and most investors are wealthy individuals and foundations, as well as development finance institutions.
correct_answers: The approach is often combined with voting and engagement.
The objective of the approach is to make better investment decisions by considering additional data, such as ESG ratings.

questions.question: Which statements about the financial market fundamentals are true?
choices: Performance is the return on investment corrected for risk.
Investments that promise higher returns generally have a higher risk.
Performance is the risk of the return on investment.
Diversification reduces the risk because the volatilities of individual investments cancel each other out.
The performance of an individual investment is generally higher than the performance of a portfolio.
correct_answers: Performance is the return on investment corrected for risk.
Investments that promise higher returns generally have a higher risk.
Diversification reduces the risk because the volatilities of individual investments cancel each other out.

questions.question: What of the following are approaches for sustainable investing options?
choices: Extraction
Impact
Systemic
Best in class
Integration
correct_answers: Impact
Best in class
Integration

questions.question: How does the exclusion of investment opportunities in sustainable investment work?
choices: Classification of enterprises in terms of ESG performance in their sectors
Identification of specific topics in connection with sustainable investment topics
Definition of limits on the revenues that can be generated by the activity
Definition of exclusion criteria and their application
correct_answers: Definition of limits on the revenues that can be generated by the activity
Definition of exclusion criteria and their application

questions.question: Mark the right statements on sustainability investments.
choices: For companies, lowering risk and return means better access to capital
Companies with high sustainability performance tend to have lower risk and lower returns, which means that their risk-return line will slide down.
When discussing the financial performance of SI, it is important to consider the time horizon.
The financial performance of SI funds is generally better than that of conventional funds.
correct_answers: For companies, lowering risk and return means better access to capital
Companies with high sustainability performance tend to have lower risk and lower returns, which means that their risk-return line will slide down.
When discussing the financial performance of SI, it is important to consider the time horizon.

questions.question: What statements about thematic investments are true?
choices: The approach is difficult to communicate.
Focusing on a sustainability issue ensures that the fund contributes to sustainable solutions.
The performance is benchmark agnostic and allows a long-term horizon.
There is a broad investment population and low dependence on regulation and subsidies, so they are considered low risk.
correct_answers: The performance is benchmark agnostic and allows a long-term horizon.

questions.question: Does sustainability pay off?
choices: Yes, definitely
No
Depends
correct_answers: Depends

quiz_title: 08 Organizational change and leadership for sustainability

questions.question: What are advantages of a central sustainability department?
choices: High acceptance of the department by employees, due to limited resource conflicts at the employee level.
Creation of an own sustainability culture within the department.
Easier integration of sustainability in organizational processes.
Formation of a clear expertise in sustainability issues.
correct_answers: Creation of an own sustainability culture within the department.
Formation of a clear expertise in sustainability issues.

questions.question: Which statements about management styles are true?
choices: A democratic leadership style leads to fast decisions and execution.
A democratic leadership style reduces a decision vacuum in case that the leader is absent.
Leaders should be able to adjust their leadership style to the situation.
An authoritarian leadership style can lead to wrong decisions due to lack of considering experience and strengths of employees.
An democratic leadership style leads to a good ability to control employees.
correct_answers: A democratic leadership style reduces a decision vacuum in case that the leader is absent.
Leaders should be able to adjust their leadership style to the situation.
An authoritarian leadership style can lead to wrong decisions due to lack of considering experience and strengths of employees.

questions.question: What are monetary incentives?
choices: Training opportunities
Working time and break regulations
Company social benefits
Piecework wage
correct_answers: Company social benefits
Piecework wage

questions.question: What statements about the organizational identity are true?
choices: The organizational identity is an important basis for individuals’ identification with the company (= degree to which an individual's goals match perceived organizational identity)
The organizational identity is the same as the organizational image.
The organizational identity is the collective self-perception of the organization.
The organizational identity describes “who we are as an organization”.
correct_answers: The organizational identity is an important basis for individuals’ identification with the company (= degree to which an individual's goals match perceived organizational identity)
The organizational identity is the collective self-perception of the organization.
The organizational identity describes “who we are as an organization”.

questions.question: What are examples of linking monetary and other incentives to sustainability?
choices: Equal pay for women and men
Introduction of sustainability targets in individuals’ agreements on objectives
Use of piecework wages instead of time wages
Company social benefits (e.g. company kindergarten)
Adaptation of employee commuting incentives
Short-term (instead of long-term) profit-sharing (e.g. stock compensation that can only be redeemed right away)
correct_answers: Equal pay for women and men
Introduction of sustainability targets in individuals’ agreements on objectives
Company social benefits (e.g. company kindergarten)
Adaptation of employee commuting incentives

questions.question: What are the advantages of dissolving old units by sale?
choices: Benefits of internal experience
Direct image improvements
Potentially transfer of old biases and processes
Release of funds for new, sustainable products
correct_answers: Direct image improvements
Release of funds for new, sustainable products

questions.question: What are the roles of the supervisory boards in times of change?
choices: Initiating change in the business environment
Initiating, limiting, and rejecting strategy proposals
Observing change on the firm level
Monitoring the corporate strategy
correct_answers: Initiating, limiting, and rejecting strategy proposals
Observing change on the firm level
Monitoring the corporate strategy

questions.question: What statements about sensebreaking and sensegiving are true?
choices: As part of sensebreaking, executive need to emphasize underperformance.
Sensegiving is the first phase of strategic change and executive emphasize a new identity.
By sensegiving, executives fill a meaning void by pointing to solutions.
Sensegiving and sensebreaking may lead to problems, when people in the company are in different phases.
correct_answers: As part of sensebreaking, executive need to emphasize underperformance.
By sensegiving, executives fill a meaning void by pointing to solutions.
Sensegiving and sensebreaking may lead to problems, when people in the company are in different phases.

questions.question: Arrange the ideal typical process of organizational change in the right order:
Which statements about the role of network effects in change are true?
choices: Changes are first communicated only to department heads and other leaders, who in turn pass them on to their subordinates.
Opinion leaders can ensure that news spread quickly and that a high level of acceptance is reached.
Network effects help to keep changes secret.
Change is only communicated via the internet in order to reach as many people as possible at the same time.
In order to drive changes forward, it is important to win other people for change who occupy a central position.
correct_answers: Opinion leaders can ensure that news spread quickly and that a high level of acceptance is reached.
In order to drive changes forward, it is important to win other people for change who occupy a central position.

questions.question: What are internal corporate barriers to sustainability?
choices: Regulations & laws
Roles & role identity
Organizational culture & identity
Incentives & interests
Resources & capabilities
correct_answers: Roles & role identity
Organizational culture & identity
Incentives & interests
Resources & capabilities

questions.question: What statements about participation processes are true?
choices: They serve to involve all shareholders in the decision-making process.
They serve to increase the acceptance of change among key stakeholders.
They serve to harness the decentralized knowledge and expertise of employees for organizational and/or social change.
correct_answers: They serve to increase the acceptance of change among key stakeholders.
They serve to harness the decentralized knowledge and expertise of employees for organizational and/or social change.

questions.question: Which statements about top-down change are true?
choices: Fast initiation of change possible
Change is initiated by employees and/or employees define their own goals and measures.
Better understanding of the need for change
Change is initiated by management, which also defines concrete goals and measures.
Better coordination of individual initiatives, if necessary
correct_answers: Fast initiation of change possible
Change is initiated by management, which also defines concrete goals and measures.

questions.question: Which statements about bottom-up change are true?
choices: Change is initiated by management, which also defines concrete goals and measures.
Better coordination of individual initiatives, if necessary
Better acceptance of change
Change is initiated by employees and/or employees define their own goals and measures.
Better understanding of the need for change
correct_answers: Better acceptance of change
Change is initiated by employees and/or employees define their own goals and measures.
Better understanding of the need for change

questions.question: Which of the following statements correctly defines the vision of an organizational change effort?
choices: Short, simple and emotionally appealing description of the final state or goal of the organization after the change has been successfully completed.
Short, simple and emotionally appealing description of the starting state of the organization before the change has been successfully completed.
Short, simple and not emotionally appealing description of the starting state of the organization before the change has been successfully completed.
Short, simple and not emotionally appealing description of the final state or goal of the organization after the change has been successfully completed
correct_answers: Short, simple and emotionally appealing description of the final state or goal of the organization after the change has been successfully completed.
